subject: Management
title: The Delegation Ladder
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Delegation Ladder.

hook.text: A new hire can't handle the same delegation as a five-year veteran. Obviousâ€”but often ignored.

buildup.text: The delegation ladder has rungs: observe, assist, do with supervision, do independently, teach others.

discovery.text: Moving someone up the ladder gradually builds skill and confidence without overwhelming them.

twist.text: Jumping from 'observe' to 'own it completely' is the most common delegation failure.

climax.text: Track where each person is on the ladder for their key tasks. Promote them one rung at a time.

punchline.text: One rung at a time builds lasting capability.

quiz.question: What is the delegation ladder?
options: A gradual progression from observing to teaching others
A ranking of which tasks to delegate first
A list of people sorted by seniority
